alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:10PM EDT until April 05 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM EDT FOR HARRISON...NORTHERN JEFFERSON...COLUMBIANA...NORTHEASTERN GUERNSEY...CARROLL...NORTHEASTERN TUSCARAWAS...WESTERN BEAVER... NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN LAWRENCE...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 710 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles southwest of Wellsville, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Weirton, Steubenville, Salem, East Liverpool, Columbiana, East Palestine, Wellsville, Cadiz, Carrollton, Freeport, Toronto, and Calcutta. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
